position: Shape the Future Challenge 2025 Turn Your Climate Solution Into Reality
jobDescription:
Spread the loveAre you a young changemaker between 15 and 24 years old with a bold idea to tackle climate change? Are you ready to collaborate with passionate peers, learn from world-class mentors, and take your solution to a global stage? The Shape the Future Challenge 2025, powered by Moonshot Pirates, is your opportunity to turn your vision into action—and even win an unforgettable innovation trip to Dubai!
This is more than a challenge—it’s a launchpad for the next generation of climate innovators.

About the Shape the Future Challenge
The Shape the Future Challenge is a global online innovation competition that empowers youth aged 15 to 24 to develop bold, impactful, and sustainable solutions for the climate crisis. Over four exciting weeks, you’ll:


Form international teams


Learn from global experts and mentors


Develop and pitch your climate solution


Compete for a trip to Dubai, where you’ll explore the heart of global innovation and sustainability


This year’s focus is Climate Action, in line with the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

Why Join?


Learn critical 21st-century skills: Ideation, design thinking, storytelling, entrepreneurship, and sustainability.


Gain mentorship from top professionals: Tech founders, climate scientists, business leaders, and more.


Collaborate across borders: Team up with peers from around the world and work toward a shared goal.


Amplify your voice and ideas: Present your project in front of a global audience, including impact-driven organizations.


Win the experience of a lifetime: An all-expenses-covered trip to Dubai, including workshops, innovation tours, and connection with sustainability leaders.



Challenge Timeline
Apply (June 6 – June 30, 2025)


Open to individuals and teams


No idea yet? No problem—you can still join and find teammates later.


All accepted participants will be invited to the Moonshot Pirates online challenge space by July 1.


Team Up (July 3 – July 6, 2025)


Attend the Opening Ceremony on July 3


Participate in fun networking events to connect with changemakers


Form your team of 2–6 members by July 6


Develop Your Idea (July 3 – July 31, 2025)


Design a radical, feasible, and impactful climate solution


Attend expert mentoring sessions and workshops


Submit your final project and 1-minute pitch video by July 31 (3 PM UTC)


Final Pitching (August 4 – August 21, 2025)


7 finalist teams will be selected through a combination of online voting and expert assessment


Finalists present their pitch during the online Pitching Ceremony on August 21


Winner receives an invitation to Dubai in early 2026



What’s at Stake?
Grand Prize: Dubai Innovation Trip (2026)


Return airfare from your nearest major international airport


Accommodation and transportation in Dubai


Visits to cutting-edge innovation hubs and green startups


Hands-on workshops and networking with climate pioneers


Bonus Opportunities:


Chance to pitch at Future Port Youth 2025 in Prague


Global exposure, mentorship, and growth opportunities long after the challenge ends



Who Can Apply?


Youth aged 15–24, from any country


Fluent in English (the entire challenge is conducted in English)


Passionate about solving real-world climate issues


No experience necessary—just a commitment to learn and collaborate


Parental consent is required for finalists under 18 years old.

What Kind of Ideas Are We Looking For?
Your project should address at least one UN Sustainable Development Goal (SDG), with a special focus on climate change. Here are a few examples of possible directions:


Clean energy innovations


Green transportation & mobility


Waste reduction & circular economy


Food security & sustainable agriculture


Smart cities & sustainable housing


Projects can be submitted as concepts or working prototypes. Judges will assess submissions based on:


Impact


Radicality


Feasibility


Wow factor



 What Will You Learn?
The challenge provides educational videos, expert-led workshops, and mentoring sessions covering:


How to identify global challenges


Ideation and brainstorming


Effective storytelling and pitching


Team collaboration


Strategic project planning


How to build sustainable business models


 Most activities take 20 min to 1.5 hours/day, designed to fit easily around school or work.

Mentoring & Support
Get access to a global pool of mentors including:


Sustainability leaders


Engineers and startup founders


Designers and technologists


Marketing and fundraising experts


Teams can book individual sessions with mentors and receive tailored feedback throughout the challenge.

FAQs (Highlights)


Free to join


Conducted entirely in English


Individual application required—even if applying as a team


International teams encouraged


Laptop and stable internet recommended


Your idea remains yours—but may also be promoted by challenge partners


Check the full FAQ here.

 How to Apply
Ready to make your mark?
Apply here by June 30, 2025
